intro: Galium scabrifolium, commonly known as roughleaf bedstraw, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to North America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a rough texture. The small, white to pale pink flowers appear in clusters during the summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
